COLE, in his underwear, leans back on a large rock beside Ford, his pants hanging on the car's open door.  He's sta at the sun and the sky.  RAILLY finishes bandaging his th

You shouldn't put your weight on it. You need stitches and antibiotics. Lucky for you it was near the surface. RAILLY wraps the bullet in some gauze and sticks it in he while COLE continues staring up at the sky.
I love seeing the sun. A beat.  COLE tries to stand up.
Wait -- let me help you. RAILLY puts an arm around him and helps him to his feet. They're very close.  They don't move.  RAILLY looks like barely breathe.
(leans closer, shuts his eyes)
You smell so good.
(trying to concentrate)
You have to give yourself up, you know. A beat.  The spell is broken.  He reaches for his pants, turns back to her, suddenly grim.
I have to do something now.  Something I don't want to do.  I'm so sorry. RAILLY reacts, sudden fear in her eyes.  He looms over he cold now, steeled.
I have a mission.  It's important. RAILLY steps back...horrified, realizing she's going to d
A SECRET SERVICE AGENT ambles vigilantly among the rows o cars parked beside the brightly-lit rural mansion.  Encou another AGENT, he pauses.
They find him?
Who??
That kid.  The one in the pipe.
You believe this?  They're dropping a monkey down there with a miniature infra-red camera strapped on him and a roast beef sandwich wrapped in tinfoil.
You're making that up! ANGLE UNDER A PARKED MERCEDES, where COLE is hiding, list the receding VOICES of the AGENTS. SECOND AGENT (o.s.)
I shit you not. ... Man, life is weird! A monkey and a sandwich.  Wonder who thought that one up. FIRST AGENT (o.s.)
Probly give the sonafabitch a Nobel Prize! Quickly, COLE rolls to the next car and under it.  He doe see...the pistol fell out of his pocket, under the Merced
A formal dinner for forty.  Desert has been served.  DR. MASON rises to the enthusiastic applause of the GUESTS.

Would that I could enjoy this opulent dinner and this excellent and stimulating company for itself, with no sense of purpose.  But alas, I am "burdened" with the sense that with all this excess of public attention and this cacophony of praise, there comes great responsibility.  Indeed, I practically feel a soapbox growing under my feet whenever I stand for more than a few seconds. While GUESTS laugh at DR. MASON'S last remark, SECRET SER AGENT #3 enters the room, scowling, looking for someone. DR. MASON (o.s.)

The dangers of science are a time worn threat, from Prometheus stealing fire from the Gods to the Cold War era of the Dr. Strangelove Terror. AGENT #3 spots who he's looking for.  JEFFREY MASON! DR. MASON (cont.)

But never before, not even at Los Alamos when the scientists made bets on whether their first atomic bomb test would wipe out New Mexico, has science given us so much reason to fear the power we have at hand. ANGLE ON JEFFREY, as AGENT #3 whispers in his ear.
What are you talking about?  What friend?  I'm not expecting anyone. ANGLE ON DR. MASON, reacting with irritation to the distu

Current genetic engineering as well as my own work with viruses has presented us with powers as terrifying as any... ANGLE ON JEFFREY, following the AGENT out of the dining r grumbling loudly enough to disturb his father's audience.
This is ridiculous.  My father is making a major address.
The conversation continues as JEFFREY and AGENT #3 enter
Normally if we caught a guy sneaking around like this with no I.D., we'd bust his ass, excuse the French, but this one said he knows you... (smirk, smirk)
-- and, since you seem to have had some...uh...unusual...uh..."associates", we certainly didn't want to arrest one of your, uh, closest...pals.
COLE, smudged with dirt and car grease, sitting in the sh a wingback chair, looks up as JEFFREY and AGENT #3 enter room.  A FOURTH AGENT looms beside the wingback chair.
(dismissing Cole casually)
Never saw him before in my life.  Go ahead and shoot him or torture him or whatever it is you do.
(rising)
You do know me.  You helped me once.
(turning to leave)
That would be totally out of character. Helping people is against my principles. (to the Agents)
See, he definitely doesn't know me.  Now, I'm going to go back and listen to my father's very eloquent discourse on the perils of science WHILE YOU TORTURE THIS INTRUDER TO DEATH.
I'm here about some monkeys. Halfway out the door, JEFFREY freezes.  A beat.
Excuse me -- what did you say?
Monkeys.  Twelve of them. JEFFREY frowns, turns, considers COLE.  Then, suddenly, J rushes to COLE and embraces him.
Arnold...Arnold. COLE is astonished.  The AGENTS are, too.
(stepping back)
My God, Arnie, what's happened to you? You look like shit
(dubious)
You know this man?

Of course I know him.  What do you think -- I act like this to strangers? Listen -- you fellas are terrific.  I thought you were pulling a number on me.  What a terrible thing if you'd thrown old Arnie out.  I owe you guys the big apologia!  Mea culpa, fellas. (turning to Cole)

Christ, Arnie, it's black tie!  I mean, I said, "drop by," but, like, this is Dad's big "do"...vips, senators, secret service, and...and everything. JEFFREY throws an arm around COLE'S shoulder and starts l him toward the door as the two AGENTS exchange narrow-eye
"Arnie?"

Arnold Pettibone.  Old Arnie Pettibone. Used to be my best friend.  Still is. What've you lost, Arnie -- forty pounds? No wonder I didn't know you. You hungry? Lots of dead cow, dead lamb, dead pig. Real killer feast we're putting on tonight. The AGENTS watch JEFFREY lead the limping, disheveled COL
These people -- all of 'em -- are true weirdoes!
(moving to the phone)
I'm gonna call in a description of this "Pettibone" character.  You go keep an eye on him.  Make sure he doesn't do one of the guests with a fork.
GUESTS pouring from the dining room into the hall meet JE and a very disconcerted COLE.
Hey, nice ta see ya.  Lookin' good!  Hi, there.  Yes, it has been a long time. In the b.g., too far away to hear them, AGENT #4 trails J COLE as they maneuver through the GUESTS toward the grand
(whispers to Cole)
County Hospital, right?  1989.  The "Immaculate Escape" -- am I right? (smiling to guests)
Why, thank you -- you look wonderful, too.
Listen to me -- I can't do anything about what you're going to do. I can't change anything.  I can't stop you.  I just want some information...
We need to talk.  Come on.  Upstairs. (to a guest)
I am a new person!  I'm completely adjusted.  Witness the tux.  It's Armani. (whispers to Cole)
Who chattered?  Goines?  Weller?
I just need to have access to the pure virus, that's all!  For the future! JEFFREY studies COLE.  COLE doesn't just talk crazy.  He
Come on, follow me.  You don't lock so good. JEFFREY starts guiding COLE up the grand staircase as COL back, spots AGENT #3 and AGENT #4, both keeping an eye on
I don't have time to go upstairs.  The police are looking for me.  I need to know where it is and exactly what it is.
(brightening suddenly)
I get it!  This is your old plan, right?
Plan?  What are you talking about?

Remember?  We were in the dayroom, watching TV, and you were all upset about the...desecration of the planet. And you said to me, "Wouldn't it be great if there was a germ or a virus that could wipe out mankind and leave the plants and animals just as they are?"  You do remember that, don't you?
Bulishit!  You're fucking with my head!
And that's when I told you my father was this famous virologist and you said, "Hey, he could make a germ and we could steal it!"
(grabbing Jeffrey)
Listen, you dumb fuck!  The thing mutates We live underground!  The world belongs to the fucking dogs and cats.  We're like moles or worms.  All we want to do is study the original...
Okay -- take it easy.  We know who you are, Mr. Cole. COLE feels a firm grip on his shoulder, turns and sees AG
Let's go somewhere and talk this thing over. Okay? Just come with me...

You're right!  Absolutely right.  Me's a nut case, totally deranged.  Delusional! Paranoid.  HIS PROCESSOR'S ALL FUCKED UP, HIS INFORMATION TRAY IS JAMMED. AGENT #4 is wishing JEFFREY would chill out even as the T AGENT is climbing up the staircase to help. COLE is like a trapped animal. He's being led down the st now with JEFFREY, right on his heels, yelling so EVERYONE

head_text.subj: YOU KNOW WHAT IT IS, THE "ARMY OF THE
NATURE KOOKS WHO RUN A STORE DOWNTOWN.
FORESTS. I HAVE NOTHING TO DO WITH
THOSE BOZOS ANYMORE. I QUIT BEING THE
RICH KID FALL GUY FOR A BUNCH OF
INEFFECTUAL BANANAS. SO MUCH FOR YOUR

text: COLE stares back at JEFFREY as both AGENTS hustle COLE do stairs.  It sounds true!  JEFFREY'S so confident.
Take it easy, Mr. Mason, we've got him. Everything's...

head_text.subj: MY FATHER HAS BEEN WARNING PEOPLE ABOUT
VIRUSES AND DNA FOR YEARS. YOU'VE
LO AND BEHOLD, I'M FRANKENSTEIN AND THE
CABAL. THIS MAN IS TOTALLY BATSHIT
KNOW WHERE HE THINKS HE COMES FROM

text: Suddenly, COLE, catching the AGENTS by surprise, wrenches shoves them aside, and stumbles down the rest of the stai
COLE heads for the front door, but there's an AGENT there turns and limps madly toward the dining room, pushing his through the crowd of amazed GUESTS.
SERVANTS, clearing the table, look up astonished as two A burst into the room.
Did a man just come through here...limping?
COOKS stare, amazed, as two OTHER AGENTS burst into the k and look about urgently.
A large projection TV is on and a knot of GUESTS is gathe front of it...watching the spooky VIDEO IMAGES. TV REPORTER (v.o.)

These pictures we are seeing are coming to us live from deep inside the pipe. You can just make out the metal wall behind those roots and I guess those must be spider webs. MRS. McCANN, a guest, watching the TV, expresses concern. MRS. McCANN

Well, if you ask me, I think that monkey is going to eat the sandwich himself. Just then, two AGENTS burst into the den. The GUESTS turn from the TV, startled, stare open-mouthed the AGENTS have spotted an open window and are hurrying t AGENTS POV OUT THE WINDOW:  the rows of expensive parked ON THE TV SCREEN, RAILLY'S photograph appears. TV ANCHOR (v.o.)

This just in:  Police say that the body of a woman found strangled in the Knutson state Park could be kidnap victim, Dr. Kathryn Railly. As the AGENTS run out of the room, a photo of RAILLY'S ab Acura comes up on the TV screen. TV ANCHOR (v.o.)
Earlier in the day, police located Railly's abandoned car not far from a building where three animal rights activists were found bound and gagged...
Pistols drawn, AGENTS move cautiously among the rows of p luxury cars, checking inside and under the vehicles. AN AGENT'S VOICE (o.s.)
COLE, scrunched down on the floor next to the driver's se spots the key dangling from the ignition, then lifts his slightly to study the shift mechanism, trying to figure i
AGENTS continue to move cautiously among the parked cars.
COLE eases himself into the driver's seat, tentatively sl shift into "Drive", then turns the key.  Nothing happens. Panic.  COLE studies the shift again.
AGENT #5 approaches the row where the Jaguar is parked.
COLE slides the shift from D (Drive) to N (Neutral).  He the key again.  The engine ROARS...SEVEN THOUSAND RPM!

AGENT #5 whirls at the sound. SMASH.  The JAGUAR clips the Mercedes parked in front of accelerates right at him! AGENT #5 dives aside just as the speeding JAGUAR whizzes him, slams into a parked Cadillac, bounces off, grinds be two other parked vehicles with a fierce scream of tearing

Caught between two cars, COLE can only lean on the gas pe The JAGUAR comes free with a great SCCCREEEEECH... COLE sees the driveway ahead in the moonlight.  Steering he plows through shrubs and gardens heading for the drive
Lights off, veering wildly, the JAGUAR reaches the drivew AGENTS are leaping into cars and a HELICOPTER is coming t its rotors whipping around.
COLE turns onto the road, careening crazily from one side other, unable to see ahead with no headlights.
He starts hitting switches.  The wipers come on, the RADI RADIO REPORTER'S VOICE/RADIO (o.s.)

---when they pulled the monkey out, it was still clutching the tinfoil wrapped sandwich. Rounding a bend, an ONCOMING CAR heads straight at COLE. COLE yanks the wheel as the OTHER CAR, horn BLARING, just Recovering, COLE loses the road, speeds crazily along the
The PILOT, an agent, steers the chopper while the CO-PILO spotlight over the two lane road beneath them. Just then, the PILOT sees headlights below.
There!  He's showing lights.
COLE can see the road now in his headlights as the windsh wipers scrape frantically and the RADIO BLARES... RADIO REPORTER'S VOICE/RADIO (o.s.)

We don't know what to think.  They didn't locate him and they don't know how much longer he can last, that's assuming the boy is still alive. A spotlight hits the car and COLE hears the sound of the HELICOPTER as it lowers over him!
The HELICOPTER maneuvers over the speeding JAGUAR.
COLE can see the underbelly of the HELICOPTER a few feet his front windshield. Desperate, he yanks the wheel hard, veering off the road. COLE'S POV THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD:  dense woods ahead.
The chopper pulls up sharply, avoiding the trees, then le
The PILOT skims the top of the trees while the CO-PILOT r forest below with his spotlight.
Goddamnit!  Where is he? The CO-PILOT gets a brief glimpse of headlights through t
There!  Over there.
Where?
Eight o'clock!  He was right there. The headlights are gone.  Nothing but darkness below.
He musta turned his lights of if.
Couldn't drive down there without lights.  We just can't see 'em.
Maybe he's not driving!

A weather forecast BLARES from the radio of the steaming crumpled into a tree, the driver's door open. A POLICE OFFICER, pistol drawn, approaches the car cautio OTHER OFFICERS and AGENTS stay behind trees, weapons read The POLICE OFFICER lunges forward, pointing his weapon in Jaguar.  He inspects the car, then turns and calls out...
He's not in here.

Limping, bleeding from various cuts, COLE CRASHES through underbrush as he follows a stream through the woods. Suddenly, he sees what he's looking for. The FORD...barely visible in the moonlight, parked in the beside the stream.  The car looks empty.
Total blackness!  The sound of keys in the lock. Then, the trunk swings open and COLE stands in the moonli looking down RAILLY is in the trunk, tears of rage and frustration in
You bastard!  You total bastard!
COLE backs away, as RAILLY scrambles out of the trunk, sw He slips, falls, and she starts kicking him as she rants
I could have died in there.  If something had happened to you I would have died. COLE is lying on the ground, looking up, his lip caked wi
I...I...I'm really sorry. Noticing his cuts and torn clothes, she stops kicking him
What have you done?  Did you...kill someone?
(getting to his feet)
No!  I...don't think so.  I stole a car and they chased me.  I hit a tree.
See -- you can drive after all!
Yeah, sort of, I guess.  I...I'm sorry I locked you up.  I thought...I thought... I think maybe I am crazy! She looks at him.  Breakthrough?  Very calm now, the doct
What made you think that?
Jeffrey Mason said it was my idea about the virus.  And suddenly, I wasn't sure.  We talked when I was in the institution, and it was all...fuzzy. The drugs and stuff. (horrified)
You think maybe I'm the one who wiped out the human race?  It was my idea?

Nobody is going to wipe out the human race.  Not you or Jeffrey or anybody else.  You've created something in your mind, James -- a substitute reality. In order to avoid something you don't want to face.
I'm..."mentally divergent".  I would love to believe that.
It can be dealt with, but only if you want to.  I can help you. COLE reacts to the sound of VOICES in the woods, dogs BAR
I need help all right.  They're coming after me.
First, it's important that you surrender to them instead of them catching you running.  Okay?
(brightening)
It would be great if I'm crazy.  If I'm wrong about everything...the world will be okay.  I'll never have to live underground.
Give me the gun.
The gun! ... I lost it
You're sure?
(showing her)
No gun! (looking up)
Stars!  Air!  I can live here.  Breathe! RAILLY starts around to the front of the car.
I'm going to attract their attention, let them know where we are, okay? RAILLY gets in the driver's seat...and starts to HONK the
(calling out)

They'll tell you to put your hands on top of your head.  Do what they tell you.  You're going to get better, James -- I know it! ANGLE ON COLE, spotting something on the ground.  An inse reaches down to grab it, but, instead, grins, grabs some stands, and starts rubbing it happily all over his face. HORN BLARES as COLE looks up at the sky. ANGLE ON THE NIGHT SKY, the moon full, the sky rich with ANGLE ON COLE, tears of joy running down his face.
I love this world! ANGLE ON RAILLY, in the driver's seat, hearing near-by SH from the woods.  The police are almost here.  She gets ou car, starts around toward COLE.
Remember, I'm going to help you.  I'll stay with you.  I won't let them... She breaks off mid-sentence...stares, stunned! COLE is gone.  Disappeared.
RAILLY is being "debriefed" by POLICE OFFICERS and FBI AG
Then I said something to him about cooperating and he said he would do that, so I got in the car and started honking the horn.  When I got out, he was gone.
You lucked out.  For a while we thought you were a body they found down state... mutilated. A COP enters, hands a photo to LIEUTENANT HALPERIN who st
He wouldn't do something like that -- he...
(interrupts, hands her the photo)
This the man he attacked? RAILLY looks at the photo, an 8 x 10 of the FIRST THUG, s against the alley wall, obviously dead.
I'd like to be clear about this.  That man and the other one were..."severely" beating us.  James Cole didn't start it.  In fact -- he saved me!

Funny thing, Doctor, maybe you can explain it to me, you being a psychiatrist -- why do kidnap victims almost always try to tell us about the guys who grabbed 'em and try to make us understand how kind these bastards really were?
(as if reciting)
It's a normal reaction to a life- threatening situation. (suddenly animated)
He's sick.  He thinks he comes from the future.  He's been living in a carefully constructed fantasy world and that world is starting to disintegrate.  He needs help!
YOUNG COLE stares, eyes wide. He sees the BRUNETTE, cradling the head of the BLONDE MAN sprawls on the concourse...
Wake up! Wake up!
I think we gave him too much.
COLE blinks awake. All he can see are blurry faces hoveri him, hammering him with questions.
Come on, Cole, cooperate!
Spit it out... you went to the home of a famous virologist...
(weakly)
You...don't...exist!  You're in my mind...
What?  What's that?  What did he say?  His brain's fried.  Give him another shot!

head_text.subj: SPEAK UP, COLE. WHAT DID YOU DO NEXT

text: The TV shows film of RAILLY leaving the police station. TV REPORTER (v.o.)

The kidnap victim seemed exhausted but apparently unharmed by her 30 hour ordeal as she left the police station in Philadelphia this morning.  So far she has refused to make a public statement. RAILLY'S friends, MARILOU and WAYNE, are watching the TV. A door opens and KATHRYN RAILLY, wearing a robe, comes ou bedroom.  She still looks exhausted   Followed by her cat enters the kitchen area and turns on the kettle as WAYNE turns down the TV.
Sorry.
No -- I'm in a state of hyper- alertness.  I can't sleep.
Did you take the sedative?
I hate those things.  They mess my head up. The old mug shot of COLE appears on the screen and RAILLY the volume up. TV REPORTER (v.o.)

Along with the kidnapping of the Baltimore woman, James Cole is now also wanted in connection with the brutal slaying of Rodney Wiggins, an ex-convict from... RAILLY goes to the window, pushes aside the drape, and se HER POV:  ACROSS THE STREET...A COP keeps watch. RAILLY (o.s.)
Do they really expect him to come here? RAILLY returns to the kitchen area where MARILOU is getti tea things out. TV REPORTER on air
And in Fresno, California...
(glances sadly toward the TV)
He's dead, isn't he -- that little boy?

He's fine.  It was just a "prank" he and his friends pulled. CLOSE ON RAILLY'S FACE... SHOCKED. ANGLE ON THE TV SCREEN, showing footage of a sheepish nin old boy being led out of a barn by the police.  The cops TV REPORTER (v.o.)
Authorities have so far been noncommittal about whether they will try to file charges against the families of the children involved in the hoax. RAILLY stares at the TV, stunned.
VOICES!  SINGING!  COLE blinks awake, looks around, confu stares in disbelief.... Crowded around COLE'S bed, the SCIENTISTS are concluding ragged, out of tune, rendition of "BLUEBERRY HILL."
---found my thrills on Blueberry Hill... Seeing he's awake, SCIENTISTS break off the song and appl
Well done, James!  Well done!  Nice going!  Congratulations!  Good for you!

During your "interview," while you were..."under the influence," you told us you liked music! COLE, confused, looks around, sees he's in a one-bed wind room adorned with cheap reproductions of 19th and 20th ce landscapes. The BOTANIST responds to COLE'S obvious disbelief with a friendly smile and the others join in rapid fire, overlap
This isn't the prison, James.
This is a hospital.
But just until you recover your, uh,... equilibrium.
You're still a little... disoriented.
Stress!  Time travel!
You stood up very well, considering...
Superior work!  Superior!
You connected the Army of the 12 Monkeys to a world famous virologist and his son...
Others will take over now...
We'll be back on the surface in a matter of months....
We'll retake the planet.
We're very close!  Because of you!
(unrolling a document)
This is it, James...what you've been working for.
A full pardon!
You'll be out of here in no time.
Women will want to get to know you...
Unseen until now, two guards, TINY and SCARFACE, suddenly through the ring of SCIENTISTS, push COLE down, and tight loose restraints, already in place, but unnoticed before.
(sympathetically)
Of course you want to be well, James. And you will be...soon. COLE bursts into hysterical laughter.

head_text.subj: YOU DON'T EXIST, YOU SILLY BOZOS

text: CLOSE ON KATHRYN RAILLY, insisting fiercely to someone,
He not only used the word "prank" -- he said the boy was hiding in a barn. RAILLY's talking to her former boss, DR. OWEN FLETCHER, p sitting across from her in his office, tapping his pen.
He kidnapped you, Kathryn.  You saw him murder someone.  You knew there was a real possibility he would kill you, too.  You were under tremendous emotional stress.
For God sakes, Owen, listen to me -- he knew about the boy in Fresno and he says three billion people are going to die!
Kathryn, you know he can't possibly know that.  You're a rational person. You're a trained psychiatrist.  You know the difference between what's real and what's not.

And what we believe is what's accepted as "truth" now, isn't it, Owen?  Psychiatry -- it's the latest religion.  And we're the priests -- we decide what's right and what's wrong --we decide who's crazy and who isn't. ... I'm in trouble, Owen.  I'm losing my faith.
Alone in his "hospital" room, COLE struggles without succ free himself from his restraints. RASPY VOICE (o.s.)
You sure fucked up, Bob! Startled, COLE freezes, then ignores the RASPY VOICE and continues his feverish struggle. RASPY VOICE (o.s.)

But I can understand you don't want your mistakes pointed out to you. I can relate to that, old Bob. COLE looks around in spite of himself.  Nothing to see bu walls and the landscape paintings. RASPY VOICE (o.s.)
Hey, I know what you're thinking.  You're thinking I don't exist except in your head.  I can see that point of view.  But you could still talk to me, couldn't you? Carry on a decent conversation?
(blurting)
I saw you! In 1995!  In the real world! You were a bum!  You pulled out your teeth. RASPY VOICE (o.s.)
Why would I pull out my teeth, Bob? They don't like that.  That's a no-no. And when did you say you saw me? In...1872?
RASPY VOICE (o.s.)
Yelling won't get you what you want.  You have to be smart to get what you want.
Oh, yeah?  What do I want? RASPY VOICE (o.s.)
You don't know what you want?  Sure you do, Bob.  You know what you want. COLE, agitated, rocks back and forth.  Then...
Tell me.  Tell me what I want. RASPY VOICE (o.s.)

To see the sky -- and the ocean -- to be topside -- breathe the air -- to be with her. ... Isn't that right?  Isn't that what you want? Completely shaken, COLE hesitates for a long moment.  Whe speaks, it comes out of him like air...a whisper.
More...than...anything.
RAILLY'S in bed, asleep, having a very bad dream.  Sudden bedside phone RINGS.  Her eyes snap open.  A beat to orie herself.  RING.  She reaches for the phone.
CLOSE ON HALPERIN, at his desk, talking into the phone.
Dr. Railly?  Jim Halperin, Philly P.D.. Sorry to call so early but... CLOSE ON RAILLY, eager, concerned. into the phone,
You found him?  Is he all right? CLOSE ON HALPEPIN, noting her reaction with raised eyebro giving an "I told you so" look to the BLACK PLAINCLOTHES across his desk, then continuing into the phone,

Au contraire, Doctor.  No sign of your good friend, the kidnapper.  However, the plot thickens.  I have a ballistic report on my desk that says the bullet you claim you removed from Mr. Cole's thigh is an antique...and all indications are it was fired...sometime prior to 1920. ANGLE ON RAILLY, reacting, stunned. ANGLE ON HALPERIN, continuing soberly now,

So what I was thinking was, maybe if I sent a detective down there to talk with you, you could maybe revise or amplify on the circumstances.... Hello?  Hello?  Dr. Railly? HALPERIN considers the dead phone, glances at the COP aga

Her hand still on the receiver, RAILLY looks shocked.  Th hurries into her study and starts frantically pulling nea arranged piles of papers and books from a bookcase until finds a copy of her book.  She leafs through it hurriedly locates the picture of the Puerto Rican KID (JOSE) in WWI Peering closely, she tries to see everything in the pictu Then, she turns and reaches for a research folder of old photographs and rummages through it until she finds...!!!
No! It's an uncropped shot of JOSE being carried on the stret the trenches.  And there in the corner with no helmet, no mask, and just a bit of bare shoulder showing...it's COLE
Clean shaven, clear eyed, COLE sits before the frowning S
The food, the sky, the certain, uh, sexual temptations -- you haven't become "addicted" have you, Cole?  To that "dying" world'
No, sir!  I just want to do my part. To get us back on top...in charge of the planet.  And I have the experience, I know who the people are...
He really is the most qualified...
But all that..."behavior"...
(to Cole, a little hurt)
You said we weren't "real," Cole...

Well, sir, I don't think the human mind was built to exist in two different... whatever you call it..."dimensions." It's stressful, you said it yourselves, it gets you confused.  You don't know what's real and what's not.
But you know what's real now?
Yes, sir. The SCIENTISTS start to confer openly among themselves
He'd have to bone up, catch up to our research, the latest clues...
He's proved to be a quick study... The ASTROPHYSICIST fixes COLE with a sharp, penetrating l
You can't trick us, you know.  It wouldn't work.
And why would you want to?  It'll be dangerously close to the end.
I understand.  There'd be no point.
We're going to think about it, Cole. Among ourselves.  We'll get back to you.

Standing in front of a wall of glass in his office, overl hi-tech lab below where WORKERS in white "space suits" wo methodically, DR. MASON speaks angrily into a phone.  His ASSISTANT, whose features we don't see, stops writing a f on a blackboard and listens.
You have reason to believe that my son may be planning to do what?!!!
RAILLY, trying to stay calm, is talking to Dr. Mason on t
Please, I know it sounds insane but...
Dr. Mason on the phone.
(into the phone)

I'm afraid this doesn't seem very professional to me, in fact it's distressingly unprofessional for some- one who treated my son briefly (if indeed you actually are who you say you are) to take a sudden unsolicited interest in his mental health six years later, and to telephone a parent to express opinions that would be inappropriate... (breaks off, listens, then)
I don't know anything about "Monkey armies", Doctor.  Nothing whatsoever. If my son ever was involved in... (listens, then,)

It would be doubly inappropriate to discuss matters of security with you, Dr. Railly, but if it will put you at ease, neither my son nor any other unauthorized person has access to any potentially dangerous organisms in this laboratory.  Thank you for your concern. DR. MASON hangs up angrily and glares. DR. MASON'S ASSISTANT (o.s.)
Dr. "Kathryn" Railly????
The psychiatrist who was kidnapped by that man who broke into my house.  She seems to have been suddenly struck by the most preposterous notion about Jeffrey. DR. MASON'S ASSISTANT (o.s.)

I attended a lecture once...Apocalyptic visions. We see Dr. Mason's ASSISTANT now.  It's DR. PETERS, the r haired man who insisted to Dr. Railly you didn't have to insane to think the world was coming to an end. DR. PETERS (cont.)
Has she succumbed to her own theoretical..."disease"? But DR. MASON is lost in thought, not listening.
Given the nature of our work, we can't ever be careful enough.  I think we should review our security procedures, perhaps upgrade them.
COLE is facing the BOTANIST who's using a pointer to indi various fading photos and newspaper clippings tacked on t
Let's consider again our current information -- if the symptoms were first detected in Philadelphia on June 28, 1995, that makes us know that...?
It was released in Philadelphia, probably on June 14, 1995.
And it appeared sequentially after that in...? With a quick glance at the panel of SCIENTISTS staring at from behind the long table, COLE replies like a good pupi
San Francisco, New Orleans, Rio de Janeiro, Rome, Kinshasa, Karachi, Bangkok, then Peking.
Meaning...???
That the virus was taken from Philadelphia to San Francisco, then to New Orleans, Rio de Janeiro, Rome, Kinshasa, Karachi, Bangkok, then Peking.
And your only goal is...???
To find out where the virus is so a qualified scientist can travel back into the past and study the original virus.
So that...???

Uh, so that a vaccine can be developed that will, uh, allow mankind to reclaim the surface of the earth. COLE glances nervously at the suspicious SCIENTISTS as th BOTANIST switches on a slide projector and projects... a magazine photo of wall graffiti:  "ATTENTION!!!  POLICE
BOTANIST (o.s.)

This is from a magazine printed in late September, 1995.  The writer speculated that this graffiti might be related to the epidemic that by that time had already killed thirty million people world-wide and was getting worse.  He says, certain people, unnamed, were questioned, but what came of that is not known.  But it is a clue you should pursue. COLE stares at the picture.

LOUD BANGING!  The storefront window, completely covered posters, quivers violently.  Images of MONKEYS covered wi electrodes, BABY SEALS being viciously clubbed, DOGS jamm tiny cages quiver as somebody beats on the window.  It's

head_text.subj: I NEED TO TALK TO YOU.

text: JEFFREY, BEN, TEDDY, and two of JEFFREY'S youthful cohort and KWESKIN, wait motionless beside a heap of cardboard c as FALE peeks out the front window through a slit between
It's the kidnap woman -- the one who was with the guy who tied us up.
What's she doing?
She's drawing attention to us, that's what she's doing. ... I don't know what you're up to this time, Mason, but you're gonna get us in deep shit!
Whine, whine, whine.  What about walkie talkies?  We used to have walkie talkies.
From littered doorways, DERELICTS sneak peeks at RAILLY a seemingly mad, shakes the doorknob, then hammers on the d
RASPY VOICE (o.s)
Secret experiments! RAILLY whirls, sees LOUIE, the raspy-voiced toothless der
That's what they do -- secret weird stuff!
You!  I know you! But LOUIE is studying the pictures of the tortured animal
Not just on them.  Do 'em on people, too -- down at the shelters.  Feed 'em chemicals 'n take pictures of 'em.
Have you seen James Cole?  The man...?
They're watchin' you.  Takin' pictures. RAILLY follows his look. ANGLE ON AN OLD CHEVY, parked across the street, the PLAI COP slouched at the wheel, pretending to read a newspaper
The police.  I know.  Listen, I need to talk to James, but he has to be careful how he contacts me.  He mustn't get caught.  Do you understand me?
Uh, yeah, sure.  Uh...who's James?

He was with me, he spoke to you. Several weeks ago.  He said you were from the future...watching him. LOUIS gives her a look that says, "I'm outta here!" But just then, RAILLY spots two TEZNAGE PUNKS surreptitio "tagging" their way along the street with cans of spray p RAILLY stares at the PUNKS.
FALE watches JEFFREY go over a check list while KWESKIN, and TEDDY organize materials, and BEN peeks out the small between posters at the front window.
You get the bolt cutters?
One dozen.  They're in the van.
One dozen bolt cutters!  Whadda you gonna do with one dozen bolt cutters?
(grins)
You really want to know?
No!  Absolutely not. Don't tell me anything.

Hey!  Do you know what she's doing? Everybody freezes, looking toward 3EN, who's peeking outs Then, except for JEFFREY, they all crowd around BEN to ge POV THROUGH SLIT:  a glimpse of RAILLY, spray painting th of the store!
What's it say?
I can't see it.
(erupting)

head_text.subj: WHY DON'T WE FORGET MY GODDAMN
PSYCHIATRIST AND DEAL WITH THE TASK AT

text: (spinning around)
Your psychiatrist?  Did you just say, "your psychiatrist"?
Ex-psychiatrist!  Now, what about flashlights?  How many flashlights...?
That woman is...was...your... psychiatrist?  And now she's spray- painting our building?

ANGLE ON SLACK PLAINCLOTHES COP, across the street in the amazed, watching RAILLY spray painting.  He shakes his he ANGLZ ON STREET TYPES, inching closer, watching RAILLY wi amazement, too.  They include... an IRISH DRUNK, white haired, red-faced, bloated... a NATIVE AMERICAN with tormented eyes and a mangled ear.. an AFRICAN AMERICAN with one eye... the TEENAGED PUNKS... a WHITE MAN, shabbily dressed, joining the knot of ONLOOK reacting at the sight of RAILLY.  It's COLE!  He pushes t
Kathryn! RAILLY stops spraying, whips around at the sound of his V
James! With a quick glance toward the PLAINCLOTHES COP, RAILLY t urgent charge of the situation.
James!  That's a policeman.  Pretend you don't know me.  If he sees you...
(turning, looking)
No, I want to turn myself in.  Where is he? (placing his hands on his head)

Don't worry -- it's all okay now.  I'm not crazy any more!  I mean, I am crazy, mentally divergent, actually, but I know it now and I want you to help me.  I want to get well... ANGLE on RAILLY, desperately pulling COLE'S hands off his she tries to block the COP'S view of COLE.

James -- put your hands down and listen to me.  Things have changed! ANGLE ON THE PLAINCLOTHES COP, checking the mug shot of C his clipboard, then reaching for his radio mike. ANGLE ON RAILLY, reacting to the COP speaking into his mi tosses the spray paint can aside, grabs COLE and tries to him along...but COLE isn't moving.  He's staring at the f the FAA Store with disbelief!

James, come on!  We have to get out of here! COLE looks from the wall to the can rolling on the sidewa then back to the wall where RAILLY has sprayed the huge w ATTENTION!!!  POLICE ARE WATCHING! IS THERE A VIRUS?  IS THIS THE SOURCE?  THREE BILLION DIE?
It's the graffiti COLE saw in the future, in the picture!
I've seen that...before. But RAILLY'S total attention is on their dilemma.

James, trust me.  We're in terrible trouble.  We have to run. Very confused, COLE lets her drag him along the sidewalk, ONLOOKERS.  She looks crazier than he does. ANGLE ON THE CHEVY, making a sudden, urgent u-turn, almos colliding with a passing car.  BRAKES SQUEAL and a HORN B
ANGLE ON BEN, peeking out, reacting to the drama.
Wow, a guy in a Chevy is chasing her and some other guy I can't see.
Hey, no problem, it's probably just another kidnapping featuring Jeffrey's shrink, pardon me, make that ex-shrink. (indicating Jeffrey to the others)
This is your leader, a certifiable lunatic who told his former psychiatrist all his plans for God knows what whacko irresponsible schemes, and now who knows what she's painted out there on our wall?

head_text.subj: WHO CARES WHAT PSYCHIATRISTS WRITE ON

text: (moves to Fale, jabs him with a finger)

You think I told her about the Army of the 12 Monkeys?  Impossible!  Know why, you pathetically ineffectual and pusillanimous "pretend-friend-to- animals"?!  I'll tell you why:  because when I had anything to do with her six years ago, there was no such thing -- I hadn't even thought of it yet!
(triumphant)
Then how come she knows what's going on? JEFFREY abruptly switches from rage to good humor, adopti supercilious smile and a patronizing tone.

Here's my theory on that.  While I was institutionalized, my brain was studied exhaustively in the guise of mental health. I was interrogated, x-rayed, studied thoroughly.  Then, everything about me was entered into a computer where they created a model of my mind. They all stare, mesmerized, at the strutting JEFFREY.  Is serious?  Is he crazy?  Doesn't matter -- he's charismati JEFFREY (cont.)

Then, using the computer model, they generated every thought I could possibly have in the next, say ten years, which they then filtered through a probability matrix to determine everything I was going to do in that period.  So you see, she knew I was going to lead the Army of the Twelve Monkeys into the pages of history before it ever even occurred to me.  She knows everything I'm ever going to do before I know it myself.  How about that? JEFFREY smiles smugly into FALE'S flabbergasted face.
Now I have to get going -- do my part. You guys check all this stuff out and load up the van.  Make sure you have everything.  I'm outta here. JEFFREY exits.  The others stare at the door.
He's seriously crazy -- you know that.

An overflowing dumpster squats near the mouth of an alley The unmarked CHEVY crawls slowly past the alley, the PLAI COP'S eyes searching everywhere. Trash stirs in the dumpster and RAILLY'S eyes peer up out torn cardboard boxes, rotting food, and styrofoam litter. HER POV:  the POLICE CAR passes from view. ANGLE ON RAILLY, emerging from the refuse, hissing,
James!  Come on. A confused COLE emerges from the opposite end of the dump bits of lettuce in his hair.
I don't understand what we're doing.
(climbing out of the dumpster)
We're avoiding the police until I can....talk to you.
(climbing out after her)

You mean, treat me?  Cure me?  Kathryn, those words on the wall -- I've seen them before...  I...I...dreamed them. But she's not listening.  She's peeking out the alley ent RAILLY'S POV:  across the street is a run-down skid row h THE GLOBE, ROOMS WEEKLY, DAILY.
The DESK CLERK, an old alkie who hates trouble but finds stares across the counter suspiciously at RAILLY and COLE
Twenty five bucks an hour.
An hour?!
You want quarter hours, go someplace else.
(catches on, pulls out her last bills)
Here's ninety eight.  For the night.  Deal? The DESK CLERK squints warily at this turn of events.  Th turns, gets a key, turns back and hands it to her.

Forty four.  Fourth floor, turn right. Elevator's busted. RAILLY turns, COLE follows, and they walk quickly to the passing the stares of gloomy RESIDENTS sitting on torn so chairs in front of an old TV with hideous color. ANGLE ON THE DESK CLERK, watching RAILLY and COLE climb stairs.  As they disappear from view, he picks up the pho punches a number, speaks into the phone.
Tommy?  This is Charlie at the Globe. You know if Wallace has a new girl? Sort of a rookie type?  Blonde?
COLE sits on the lumpy bed in the dingy room, watching RA pace back and forth like a mad woman.
Okay...you were standing there looking at the moon...you were eating grass... then what?
I thought I was in...prison again.
Just like that?  You were in prison?
No, not really.  It's...it's in my mind.  Like you said.
You disappeared!  One minute you were there, the next minute you were gone. Did you run through the woods?
I don't know -- I don't remember.
The boy in the well.  How did you know that was just a hoax?
It was?  I didn't...know.
James, you said he was hiding in the barn...
I think I saw a TV show like that when I was a kid.  Where a boy...
COLE looks at her.  She's really upset.

Well, maybe that kid saw the same TV show and copied it.  Listen, you were right, it's all in my head.  I'm mentally ill, I imagine all that stuff.  I know they're not real, I can trick them, make them do what I want.  I just worked on them in my head and I got back here.  I can get better.  I can stay here. RAILLY pulls a photo from her purse, shows it to COLE. It's the uncropped picture from her book, the photo of JO WWI with a fuzzy image of COLE on the edge of the frame,
What does this mean to you?
...I had a dream about...something like that.
You had a bullet from World War One in your leg, James!  How did it get there?
You said I had delusions -- that I created a world -- you said you could explain everything...

Well, I can't. ... I mean...I'm trying to.  I can't believe that everything we do or say has already happened, that we can't change what's going to happen, that I'm one of the three billion people who are going to die...soon. COLE stands, moves close to her.
I want to be here.  In this time.  With you.  I want to become...become a whole person.  I want this to be the present. I want the future to be unknown.
(sudden hopeful idea!)

James...do you remember...six years ago...you had a phone number!  You tried to call and... WHAM!  The door flies open, kicked violently, the flimsy holding.  A menacing figure stands in the doorway.  WALLA wiry biker-type with jail house tattoos and mean eyes. COLE and RAILLY are too stunned to say anything as WALLAC them over coldly, insolently, then advances on RAILLY.
This is my territory, bitch!
(confused, turns to Railly)
Is this real -- or is this one of my delusions?
This is definitely real: (to Wallace)

Excuse me, I think we have a little misunderstanding here... WALLACE smashes RAILLY in the face.  She flies back again wall and onto the floor as WALLACE spins around to COLE w stepping toward him, but WALLACE is now holding a knife

What're you -- some kind of tough guy? You wanna be a hero?  You gonna try and mess with me?  Come on... A beat.  COLE puts his hands up placatingly as he backs a WALLACE and moves to RAILLY, whose eye is already swellin

Now that's a smart boy.  But you, honey, you think you can go 'round me and peddle your fancy ass in this part of town, you bet your life we got what I would call a major goddamn misunderstandin'. RAILLY reaches a hand up to COLE for assistance, but, he her purse instead, swings it around, SMASHES WALLACE in t with it, then grabs the pimp's arm and SNAPS it like it w twig!  The knife clatters to the floor as WALLACE yelps i and COLE slams him to the floor, straddles his chest, ret the near-by knife, and presses it sharply against WALLACE
COLE hesitates.
(eyes bulging)
You...heard...her.  Don't do it, man.
(gets up, looks around)
Put him in the closet, ... But get his money first.
(amazed)
You want me to rob him?
I...I...We need cash, James. A shadow.  RAILLY turns toward the door and glimpses a FA disappearing, then hears SHOUTS from the hallway... SHOUTS (o.s.)
They're killing him!  Call the cops. Being very careful not to move his neck, WALLACE reaches pocket and produces a thick roll of bills, which RAILLY g

You two are crazy.  I got friends.  You put me in a closet, they're gonna be really pissed. COLE moves off Wallace and, keeping the knife close, yank his teeth while RAILLY hurries to the window and looks ou HER POV:  A fire escape leads down into an alley. RAILLY turns just in time to see COLE shove WALLACE into bathroom, follow him in, slam the door behind them, and L
James, no!
RAILLY'S VOICE (from the other room) (rattling the door knob)
James, what are you doing? WALLACE cowers back against the shower stall.
I have friends, man -- if you cut me... WALLACE breaks off, bug-eyed, reacting to something we do
What...the...fuck..are you doing???
RAILLY is pounding on the bathroom door now as, suddenly, opens and COLE steps out, the knife in his right hand, dr with blood.
Oh, my God, James.  Did you kill him? COLE shakes his head "no" as blood oozes from his mouth.
Just...just in case.  In case I'm not crazy... (holds up two bloody molars)
That's how they find us.  By our teeth. (a beat, eye contact)

I don't want them to find me.  Ever.  I don't want to go back. RAILLY's astonishment turns to emotion as it dawns on her choice he's made.  Given up the future (if it exists, and looking like it does)!  Risking his life to be with her! this brief time!  She's overwhelmed, lips trembling, tear welling in her eyes.  But just then, the SOUNDS of SHOUTS feet THUNDERING up the stairs snap her back to reality.
COPS' boots THUNDER up the stairwell.
In between nervous glances toward the door, RAILLY superv COLE obediently blocks the bathroom door with the bureau.
Push it tight! WALLACE'S VOICE (from the bathroom)
POLICE OFFICERS, led by the PLAINCLOTHES COP, make a caut entrance onto the 4th floor, guns drawn. Seedy HOTEL RESIDENTS point to Room 44, then cower back i their doorways.

COLE and RAILLY clatter down the fire-escape, COLE in the They come to the end of the metal stairway.  It's a long to the ground.  COLE jumps down, turns, reaches up to her She lets herself down to him.  Their eyes meet.  He holds his arms for a moment.  Then, reluctantly, he puts her do They start running down the alley.
The PLAINCLOTHES COP has his pistol out, his back to the alongside the open doorway to Room 44.  The UNIFORMED OFF are backing him up, weapons drawn.
No response.

The PLAINCLOTHES COP charges into the room in a crouch, p extended in both hands.  He pans the gun around the empty HIS POV:  the open window...the blood on the floor. WALLACE'S VOICE (from the bathroom)

head_text.subj: COKED-UP WHORE AND A CRAZY DENTIST

text: A city bus disgorges a stream of PASSENGERS at a stop in toney downtown shopping district.  Among them, RAILLY loo furtively left and right, COLE on her heels.  She's hidde bruised eye behind sun glasses; he's holding a bloody handkerchief to his mouth. As he steps to the sidewalk, COLE is overwhelmed by the b city, the tall downtown buildings.  His eyes go up. COLE'S POV:  a building, towering toward the sky.  A buil with a ledge.  The same ledge the lion prowled in the fut ANGLE ON COLE, shaken, as RAILLY ushers him into the rece entrance to a store.

Wait here.  I'm going to try that phone number.  Let's hope it's nothing! Dazed by his experience and the flow of SHOPPERS, COLE wa her hurry to a pay phone twenty yards away, his view of h intermittent by PEDESTRIANS streaming past him, their FAC looming frighteningly close. A BUSINESSMAN jostles COLE, forcing him back against the window.  Turning, he faces the angry jaws of a BEAR only Recovering from a jolt of terror, COLE realizes the BEAR toy in the display window.  Relieved, he looks back at RA COLE'S POV:  RAILLY, well out of earshot, speaking earnes the phone. ANGLE ON COLE, startled, as a BUSINESSMAN, mistaking him panhandler, shoves a dollar into his hand.  Confused, COL at the dollar, then turns to say something to the retreat BUSINESSMAN, but just then he sees RAILLY rushing toward eyes sparkling with happiness, LAUGHING, ebullient.
James!  James!  It's okay.  We're insane!  We're crazy! COLE doesn't know how to respond, but a PASSERBY gives th
It's a Carpet Cleaning Company...
A Carpet Cleaning Company?
(laughing)
No superiors!  No scientists.  No people from the future.  It's just a Carpet Cleaning Company.  They have voice mail -- you leave a message telling them when you want your carpet cleaned.
You... you left them a message?
(impishly)

I couldn't resist.  I was so relieved. Wait'll they hear this nutty woman telling them...they better watch out for the Army of the Twelve Monkeys... Looking at her laughing face, COLE is struck with horror realizes the truth!  He starts to recite...

"The Army of the Twelve Monkeys -- they're the ones who are going to do it.  I can't do anything more.  The police are watching me." Now she's stunned.  She glances back and sees the phone b twenty yards away.
You... you couldn't have heard me.

They got your message, Kathryn.  They played it for me.  It was a bad recording...distorted.  I didn't recognize your voice. RAILLY'S eyes fill with horror as she grasps the meaning. ANGLE ON A UNIFORMED COP, staring out the window of a POL CRUISER as it inches along in the bumper to bumper traffi Noticing something, he reaches for his radio. ANGLE ON RAILLY, spotting the CRUISER, grabbing COLE, pul into the CROWD.
Come on.
RAILLY, whose sun glasses don't really hide her bruised e a man's Hawaiian shirt to the pile of other men's things on a counter in front of a very suspicious CLERK.
And this. (turning)

Anything else? But COLE'S not here.  He's a short distance away...starin COLE'S POV:  aisle after aisle of eager shoppers and a bo brand new consumer goods. ANGLE ON COLE, remembering another department store, dark full of moldering merchandise. ANGLE ON RAILLY, turning again to the CLERK.
I guess that's it.
Shall I put this on your account, Ma'am?
(producing Wallace's roll of bills)
No -- I'll pay cash. The CLERK stares at the huge roll of bills!
What floor are the wigs on, please?
Surrounded by stripped and abandoned vehicles, the VAN, w PEST CONTROL logo on its side, is parked on a trash-litte street beside the massive pillars of a towering freeway.
The VAN is packed with SIX ACTIVISTS, SANDY and KWESKIN a them, all wearing black.  Some of them have climbing gear belts, all sorts of paraphernalia.  KWESKIN is telling hi
So then he goes into this incredible riff about how his shrink, like, replicated his brain while he was in the nut house. Turned it into a computer.
And Fale believed it?

Oh, you know Fale!  He's like, "If you guys get nailed -- and I'm sure you will -- I never saw you before in nay life!" LAUGHTER from all of them.  Then, there's a sharp, rhythm series of RAPS on the side door, a signal. POPE quickly slides the door open.  It's JEFFREY...grinni Three other activists, GOINES, ICHIOKA, and BRUHNS, stagg the darkness behind JEFFREY, lugging a huge, squirming GA The van occupants react with murmurs of "Awwwwwright" and out", then they help maneuver the writhing bag into the v Then, JEFFREY and the other three scramble in, too.
Let's do it!
The PEST CONTROL VAN lumbers up a ramp and onto the freew
The GARBAGE BAG squirms and grunts as JEFFREY holds a map flashlight and goes over "the plan" with the other ACTIVI
Okay, that's Stage One.  In Stage Two, Monkey Four is over here... A loud GROAN from the bag distracts the others.
What's the harm in opening the bag? His eyes are taped.
Yeah, it's cruel leaving him like that.
Ah, but cruelty is his specialty.
So why should we be like him? Shrugging cheerfully, JEFFREY tears open the garbage bag DR. MASON, trussed up, duct tape covering his eyes and mo
Want the full effect? Grinning wickedly, JEFFREY rips the tape from his father'
Jeffrey?  I know it's you, Jeffrey.  I recognize your voice. JEFFREY puts his finger to his lips, silencing everyone.

JEFFREY???  ... Very well.  You're out of your mind, Jeffrey.  I know all about your insane plan.  That woman -- your psychiatrist -- she told me. JEFFREY raises his eyebrows.  This he hadn't expected.

I didn't believe her -- it seemed too crazy even for you.  But, just in case, I took steps to make sure you couldn't do it.  I took myself out of the loop!  I don't have the code any more.  I don't have access to the virus.  So, go ahead -- torture me, but you can't extract anything of use to yourself. The ACTIVISTS are all exchanging puzzled looks.
What...virus?
(spins his head toward Jeffrey)
She knew about it, Jeffrey.  She knew you were going to try this.
What virus are we talking about, Dad?
You're insane, Jeffrey.
You "develop" viruses and you're calling me insane?  Typical.  What does this virus attack?  Don't tell me, you sick fuck, it doesn't matter. (to the others)

Have I ever "developed" a virus?  Do I put helpless animals in cages and measure their reactions to electrical stimuli? Do I inject radioactive substances into living creatures and examine their bowel movements?  Wow!  And I'm crazy!
Please tell me, Jeffrey, what exactly are you going to do?  I don't have to tell you I'm afraid.

head_text.subj: OUR HELPLESS LITTLE TEST ANIMAL, DADDY.
HAVE YOU COME UP WITH, YOU DEMENTED

text: Spooky BERNARD HERRMAN MUSIC, giant redwoods looming skyw It's DAYTIME in Muir Woods.  SCOTTY (JAMES STEWART) AND M (KIM NOVAK) walk toward a display of a cross cut section redwood tree.  We're watching Hitchcock's VERTIGO. SCOTTY (up on the screen)
Here's a cross section of one of the old trees that's been cut down. They look at the lines of the tree marked with cards that

head_text.subj: "BIRTH OF CHRIST", "DISCOVERY OF AMERICA", "MAGNA CARTA S

text: "1066 - BATTLE OF HASTINGS", and "1930 TREE CUT DOWN". ANGLE ON THE THEATER AUDIENCE, empty seats dimly visible flickering light, a few shadowy MOVIEGOERS scattered here ANGLE ON THE SCREEN, MADELINE pointing, saying with profo MADELINE (up on the screen)

Somewhere in here I was born.  And here -- I die.  There's only a moment for you.  You don't notice. ANGLE ON THE AUDIENCE, a shadowy COUPLE near the back of theater.  WE CAN'T REALLY SEE THEM, but we recognize thei
Here, let me help you. The theater is briefly illuminated by a very bright scene screen, revealing enough of COLE and RAILLY for us to see doing something to his upper lip while he tries to watch
I think I've seen this movie before. When I was a kid.  It was on TV.
(fussing with his upper lip)
Shh -- don't talk.  Hold still.
(moving his head to see the film)

I have seen it, but I don't remember this part.  Funny, it's like what's happening to us, like the past.  The movie never changes -- it can't change -- but everytime you see it, it seems to be different because you're different -- you notice different things.
If we can't change anything...because it's already happened, then we ought to at least smell the flowers.
Flowers!  What flowers? From the darkness, a MOVIE PATRON makes a SSSSHHHHH shoun
(whispering)
It's an expression.  Here... She's pulling something from a shopping bag at her feet, it on COLE'S head, adjusting it...
Why are we doing this?

So we can stick our heads out the window and feel the wind and listen to the music.  So we can appreciate what we have while we have it.  Forgive me, psychiatrists don't cry. There are tears in her eyes.  They discomfit COLE.
But maybe I'm wrong.  Maybe you're wrong.  Maybe we're both crazy.

In a few weeks, it will have started or it won't.  If there are still baseball games and traffic jams, armed robberies and boring TV shows -- we'll be so happy, we'll be glad to turn ourselves in to the police.
(whispers)
Where can we hide for a few weeks? ANGLE ON THE SCREEN, where SCOTTY and MADELINE are in the the OCEAN behind them.
You said you'd never seen the ocean...

CLOSE ON A GORILLA, by moonlight, angry, a true nightmare URGENT WHISPERS off screen, RUSTLING SOUNDS.  Then, METAL Only now are we aware that the GORILLA is in an outdoor z with phony rocks.  Stalking back and forth.  Huge.  Upset CLANK.  CLANK.  METAL ON METAL.  GRUNTS of effort, then, MASON'S VOICE, plaintive, frightened. DR. MASON'S VOICE (o.s.)
What are you doing to me?  Where are we?  Jeffrey, please... SANDY'S VOICE (o.s.)
For God's sake, put the tape back on his mouth! The GORILLA bellows angrily, beating his chest. JEFFREY'S VOICE (o.s.)
Forget the tape.  The monkey's louder than he is.  You gonna tape the monkey's mouth?
Under the full moon, PANTHERS pace back and forth, back a forth, uttering ominous guttural SNARLS.
The KING OF BEASTS gives a deep, fierce ROAR.  From the d unseen ELEPHANTS TRUMPET their response.

A PANDEMONIUM of WINGS RUSTLING, the sharp metallic CLINK metal on metal, the MUTTER of HUMAN VOICES, then a cacoph CRESCENDO of frenzied SCREECHING as PARROTS, COCKATOOS an EXOTIC BIRDS careen madly in their cages.

CLOSE ON COLE, dozing fitfully, as the SOUNDS of SCREAMIN continue.  Suddenly, he comes awake with a start...sees t filling his field of vision. HIS POV:  the MOVIE SCREEN.  TIPPI HEDRIN, overwhelmed by screeching BIRDS in an attic in Hitchcock's THE BIRDS. ANGLE ON COLE, orienting himself, looking around.  Empty both sides of him.  He's alone.  He panics.
Kathryn?!

A lobby poster boasts "Classics 24 Hours A Day" and "Hitc Festival".  PANNING OFF the poster, passing a SNORING USH to the world in an old velvet chair, WE DISCOVER a BRUNET tight dress, just hanging up the lobby pay phone.  Turnin reveals heavy make-up, gaudy costume jewelry, and sun gla She's the BRUNETTE in COLE'S DREAM!  Crossing the lobby t the auditorium, it's a pleasure to watch her nice body un in the tight dress. Just then, the auditorium doors burst open and a BLONDE M Hawaiian shirt appears, the man from COLE'S DREAM, except man's moustache is fixed firmly on his upper lip.  The BL stops, stunned at the sight of the BRUNETTE.
We're booked on a 9:30 flight to Key West. The Brunette is RAILLY, no longer the frazzled profession revealed now by her disguise as a sexy babe.  The Blonde COLE!  He's confused.
You were in my dream just now.  I didn't recognize you.
Well, you look pretty different, too.
I mean in my dream -- I didn't realize it was you.  Then...I woke up and I...I thought you were gone.
(studies him seriously)

I remember you...like this.  I feel I've known you before.  I feel I've always known you. Their eyes lock.  Suddenly, she backs up, gently maneuver with her, past the sleeping USHER, to and through an unlo unmarked door, then closing it behind them.

RAILLY and COLE are in a dimly lit cluttered storage room kisses him hungrily amid the brooms, plastic trash barrel janitorial items.  COLE responds to her passion as they m deeper into the room, its walls covered with old movie po Tearing at each other's clothes, they collapse on a rolle theater curtain among stacks of ancient theater seats.

The red rim of the rising sun is just becoming visible be silhouetted roofs of an upper middle-class suburban neigh The early light is so vague that when a huge SIBERIAN TIG across a neatly-trimmed lawn, he's more a shadowy vision reality.  Did we really see him at all?
The rising sun flares behind the towering silhouette of a building, deserted in the early morning light.  High up, his head around a girder. Four stories below, other MONKEYS are climbing.

Deserted in the first light of dawn, the stores face each across a broad promenade with blank staring windows. Nothing happens.  For a long moment.  Then, an AFRICAN BU ELEPHANT appears, turning the corner, lumbering toward us the promenade, raising his trunk to TRUMPET triumphantly other ELEPHANTS trotting into view behind him.
A fiftyish WOMAN CABBIE with white hair and a Southern tw at the wheel of the cab. WOMAN CABBlE
What time's your flight, friends? In the back seat, COLE, in the blonde wig and moustache, his companion, the sexy babe in sun glasses and heavy mak
Nine thirty
Might be tight.
(startled, checks her watch)
Tight?  My watch says 7:30.
On your normal mornin', okay, plenty a time, but today, gotta take inta account your Army-of-the-Twelve-Monkeys factor.
What?  What did you say?
Twelve Monkeys, honey.  Guess you folks didn't turn on your radio this morning. COLE and RAILLY exchange a quick look.
